channel.title: Simple How to guides - the wedge that opens new disciplines
channel.description: Alex Hogrefe's making waves with a new kind of architectural consultancy, [architectural visualisation](http://www.designdistill.com/viz). The basic idea is that better visuals help people understand a concept sooner. But more than sketches, this form of visualisation helps you get the feel for a place. You can see why his latest visualisation has gone viral: You can think of realistic [visualisations](http://community.source.institute/t/facilitation-skill-visual-thinking/155) as a form of early prototyping, like Frank Gehry, except these visuals illicit more emotional responses and feedback early in the design. Interdisciplinary community leaders will recognise this as a convergence. And in this case, we can see how Alex created an inflection point to build a small but impactful community around him: [the blog he started in university](https://visualizingarchitecture.com/) was full of practical how-tos. How Tos for a very narrow niche. > I created this website in the summer of 2009 while a student at Miami University of Ohio working towards a Master of Architecture degree. The original intention was to use the website as a means to communicate to my instructors the progress I was making on my thesis work. Here he shows how to fake a sold-out crowd. https://youtu.be/r5hwv4OYpR8 This is worth experimenting with [The Sources.](http://thesources.co) - we have a similar type of convergence, with small niche needs at the intersection of different markets and technologies, and a lack of practical instruction in all of them.
